deck_excerpt: Pure deck drytron, easy to farm in Master Duel
deck_description:
Deck strategy focused on:
  • Skip phase/turn
  • Return monster/spell/trap from the opponent field to hand
  • Card destruction
  • Extra deck monster effects negation
COMBOS Skip phase/turn Cards you need : Amorphactor Pain, the imagination Dracoverlord + Terminal World
  1. Ritual summon Amorphactor Pain, the imagination Dracoverlord when this card is special summon the next main phase 1 of your opponent will be skipped and all the extra deck monsters will have negated effects (except link monsters)
  2. If you have Terminal World use it before you enter in battle phase otherwise you cant be able to activate it, if terminal world was activated you will skip the main phase 2 of both players
  3. This combo can be used as a loop until you do an otk
  Return spells/traps to hand/up to 3 monsters/clean the opponent field without destroy Cards you need : Odd-Eyes Gravity Dragon + Shinobaron Peacock
  1. Sometimes the backrow is the most dangerous thing on field, having this on mind first ritual summon Odd-Eyes Gravity Dragon to return to opponent hand all the spells & traps, the opponent cant use those cards just if one of those will negate the Odd-Eyes summon
  2. Special summon Shinobaron Peacock to return up 3 monsters of the opponent, the better of this effects is Shinobaron doesnt target this effect its perfect to clean untargeteable monsters or indestructible monsters
  Clean all the field with Zeus Cards you need : Up to 4 drytron lvl one monsters + Lyrilusc - Assembled Nightingale + Divine Arsenal AA-Zeus
  1. Special summon up to 4 drytron monsters then special summon Lyrilusc - Assembled Nightingale at this point dont set cards or summon important monsters
  2.  Enter in battle phase and attack with Lyrilusc important thing use lyrilusc effect to attack directly you will attack the same times as monsters you have attached                                                                                   ex. you have 2 monsters attached, you can attack directly 2 times 
  3. Finish the battle phase and summon Divine Arsenal AA-Zeus use his effect to send all the cards to graveyard this effect is perfect to comfront indestructible monsters
  TRICKS
  • Drytrons use tributes to special summon and activate his effects always try to tribute cards in your hand to reach the most summons you can
  • If you just have Drytron Alpha Tuban and other drytron ever use Alpha as your first effect then search a ritual monster and then activate the other drytron monster otherwise you will have a nice brick
  • Combine this deck with Cyber Emergency to have more searcher cards
    COMBOS Saltar main phase/turno completo Cartas necesarias : Amorphactor Pain, the imagination Dracoverlord + Terminal World
  1. Invoca por ritual a Amorphactor Pain, the imagination Dracoverlord cuando esta carta es invocada salta la siguiente main phase del oponente además de que todos los monstruos del extra deck tendrán negados sus efectos (Excepto links)
  2. Si tienes Terminal World activala antes de entrar a battle phase de otra forma no podrás activarla después, si terminal world fue activada saltarás la main phase 2 de ambos jugadores
  3. Este combo puede ser usado como loop
  Regresa magias/trampas a la mano/hasta 3 monstruos en campo/limpia el campo oponente sin destruir Cartas necesarias : Odd-Eyes Gravity Dragon + Shinobaron Peacock
  1. Algunas veces el backrow es lo más peligroso en el campo, teniendo en cuenta esto primero invoca a Odd-Eyes Gravity Dragon para regresar todas las magias/trampas a la mano del oponente, el no podrá usar cartas en respuesta sólo sí es para negar la invocación de Odd-Eyes
  2. Invoca a Shinobaron Peacock para regresar hasta 3 monstruos del campo oponente, lo mejor de este efecto es que no selecciona lo cual lo hace perfecto para monstruos que no pueden ser seleccionados o indestructibles
  Limpia todo el campo con Zeus Cartas necesarias : Hasta 4 monstruos drytron de nivel 1 + Lyrilusc - Assembled Nightingale + Divine Arsenal AA-Zeus
  1. Invoca de manera especial hasta 4 monstruos drytron para después invocar desde el extra deck a Lyrilusc - Assembled Nightingale una vez hecho esto no coloques ni invoques cartas importantes
  2.  Entra a la fase de batalla y ataca con Lyrilusc importante usa el efecto de lyrilusc para atacar directamente, podrás atacar directamente tantas veces como monstruos acoplados tenga 
  3. Termina la battle phase e invoca a Divine Arsenal AA-Zeus y usa su efecto para enviar todas las cartas al cementerio, este efecto sirve para enfrentar monstruos que no pueden ser destruidos por efecto
  TRUCOS
  • Los Drytron usan tributos para invocarse de manera especial y usar sus efectos, aiempre intenta tributar los monstruos de tu mano para lograr invocar la mayor cantidad de monstruos que puedas
  • Si sólo tienes a Drytron Alpha Tuban y otro drytron (el que sea) siempre usa primero el efecto de alpha para buscar un monstruo ritual y después activar al otro drytron de otra forma vas a brickearte
  • Combina este deck con cartas como Cyber Emergency para tener más buscadores

deck_excerpt: F2P Invoked Dogmatika Deck, Simple and New Player Friendly
deck_description:
Invoked Dogmatika is one of my picks for best decks to pick up if you're just getting back into Yu-Gi-Oh with the release of Master Duel, granted building the deck is a bit... weird due to Master Duel constraints. First and foremost the cards "Magical Meltdown" and "Nadir Servant" are normally available at 3 copies in the TCG, however Konami has taken the OCG's stance on these cards and limited them to 2 copies and 1 copy respectively. The hit to Magical Meltdown just makes seeing "Aleister the Invoker" and thus the entire Invoked half of the deck more annoying and inconsistent, whereas the hit to "Nadir Servant" greatly reduces consistency on the Dogmatika half of the deck as well as the deck's ability to break your opponent's board due to not being able to send "Elder Entity N'tss" and start your plays. Secondly, you may have noticed the "Fusion Destiny" package aiming to summon "Destiny HERO - Dystopia". This is probably bad, full stop. HOWEVER, it is very funny and the actually good target "Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer" is currently not in Master Duel. While Dystopia's 1600 burn damage and 3800 ATK after the effect of "Destiny HERO - Dynatag" do help assemble lethal both in and out of the battle phase, the reality is that this deck doesn't need it and would much prefer the recurring body of DPE. A more standard Shaddoll package of "Shaddoll Fusion" and cards like "Naelshaddoll Ariel" and "Shaddoll Dragon" is assuredly better, but Dystopia is funnier and thats the hill I choose to die on. Third, the extra deck here is not optimized by any means, there is a strong argument to cut two of the Invoked Fusion Monsters besides "Invoked Mechaba" or "Invoked Purgatrio" to fit in two more copies of "Elder Entity N'tss". I've opted for the two additional Invoked targets "Invoked Caliga" and "Invoked Magellanica" entirely to take advantage of "Invocation's" ability to use opponent's graveyard monsters as material for their summon. For example, you can banish an opponent's one copy of "Zoodiac Drident", their "Block Dragon", or even their "Sky Striker Ace - Raye" so that if you're not able to end the game right then and their you won't have to deal with them the following turn. Magellanica is also has 3000 ATK for use with "Dogmatika Punishment", though I like to think of this as a happy coincidence. Next up, Hand Trap ratios. Master Duel is a super jank format best-of-one format with a banlist that looks like a pre-pandemic OCG list where someone just forgot about a few cards. Drytron, Adamancipator, Gem-Knight FTK*, Sky Striker, Thunder Dragon, Virtual World, Pendulum, Eldlich and so many more are better than we ever got to play them in the TCG and people are taking FULL advantage of it. As a result, I've opted for the hand traps you see before you, 3 pieces of main deck spell trap removal and 5 uniquely named hand traps, resulting in 13-16 pieces of generic interaction. The philosophy behind this is basically "if my opponent opts to simply play through 'Maxx "C"', there has to be a punish for it eventually", a lot of these decks are so cracked that you might need 2-3 pieces of interaction to even start contesting their board on either turn. Lastly, some important things to note about weird interactions if you're new to the deck:
  • "Droll & Lock Bird" and 'Maxx "C"' conflict, you can activate both on the same turn to stop your opponent from adding cards from their deck to hand, but you will not get the draws from Maxx C due to Droll being a symmetric effect.
  • The effects of "Nadir Servant", "Dogmatika Maximus" and "Dogmatika Ecclesia, the Virtuous" to lock you out of the extra deck only apply if the effects to search actually resolve, they can be used to bait out interaction, though if you're going first or have already cracked their board they should be used as late as possible.
  • The Dogmatika extra deck lock prevents summoning from the extra deck, "Fusion Destiny" prevents special summoning in general, you can't use both parts of the deck on the same turn.
  • On a largely empty board Aleister > Almiraj > Secure Gardna > Invocation for Purgatrio represents a 2300-3300+ ATK piercer that can attack every monster (even if its summoned during the battle phase) and the 1k from Secure Gardna. Dystopia adds 1600 burn alongside 3800 if you're able to avoid using the destruction effect.
  • There are strong cases to be made for playing "Dark Ruler No More" over "Infinite Impermanence", and "Evenly Matched" over "Cosmic Cyclone". These would weaken your hands going first but greatly improve your ability to break strong boards if you're going second.
tl;dr: The Dystopia package is cope, so are the extra Invoked cards probably. Go second. Normal Summon Aleister.

deck_excerpt: Searching for a slept on fun deck? then look no further than our athletic bois! (U.A)
deck_description:
With the recent addition of Master Duel there has been a huge spike in popularity again with this fabled card game!

However for a lot of returning old school players or even those who have been out of the loop for a little while the game can be frustrating at times to play against the top meta decks.

Now if your anything like me you love a powerful feeling yet simple deck that is fun to play and doesnt feel like playing solitare and pulling off a 30 card combo that takes 30 minutes for just one turn.

This is where our good friends the Ultra athletes come in!

Now by any means this isnt a super competitive deck and it can brick sometimes (not very often now with the new supports) but often your opponent has never seen or played against this deck meaning you have an element of surprise and even a OTK chance.

So who are the Ultra Athletes and what do they do?

Well plain and simple UA works but "substituting" your cards during your main phases to give you an "offensive and defensive" team layout. You will typically play an offensive line to take out your opponents cards, backrow and LP then swap them out in MP2 for a defensive counter line for their turn.

This is a lot of fun to pull off and keeps your opponent guessing at what you have up your sleeve plus with the amazing field spell and arguably the best equip spell in the game you can really surprise an unknowing player!

The UA deck has a lot of 5* and above monsters (thankfully with the new support you now have more 4* options to get them out) so it can brick due to this but recently out of a good 70 odd duels ive hard bricked once.

How does this substitution work? Well all UA monster cards have the effect: " You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by returning 1 "UA." monster you control to the hand, except "UA. .....". You can only Special Summon "UA. ...." once per turn this way." this is effectively you swapping your offensive and defensive strats and playing to your opponents weaknesses!

Lets get into the cards and how they are used in the deck i currently run:

UA Midfielder 4* 1200 / 1000 :

You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by returning 1 "UA." monster you control to the hand, except "UA. Midfielder". You can only Special Summon "UA. Midfielder" once per turn this way. During either player's turn: You can target 1 other "UA." monster you control; return that face-up monster to the hand, then Special Summon 1 "UA." monster from your hand with a different name from that monster. You can only use this effect of "UA. Midfielder" once per turn.

This is one of the two 4* monsters you have access to and is normally your starting catalyst for getting your main forces out.

Now the secondary effect i often dont use unless you are in the battlephase and really want to lay down some hurt on the opponent.

the reason the second effect i find doesnt get used often is because you will typically swap this card out from the field to get your big bois out.

nevertheless this is a must have card in your deck and 3 of them.

UA Libero Spiker 4* 1800 / 1800:

You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by returning 1 "UA." monster you control to the hand, except "UA. Libero Spiker". You can only Special Summon "UA. Libero Spiker" once per turn this way. During your opponent's Main Phase (Quick Effect): You can shuffle 1 Level 5 or higher "UA." monster from your hand into the Deck, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "UA." monster from your Deck with a different name, then return this card to the hand. You can only use this effect of "UA. Libero Spiker" once per turn

This is one of the newest support cards UA got and my god it was a much needed one!

It is the only other 4* the archetype has and it has certainly a more useful second effect and is great for little combos for defence or to start filling your board!

you can leave this little bugger out and during your opponents turn immediatly swap it to a "rival rebounder" which gives you a resurection from your GY or play directly from your hand!

Alternatively it allows you to pull out the right card for whatever your opponent summons. I Love this card and am very happy UA got this support!

UA Mighty Slugger 5* 2300 / 700:

You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by returning 1 "UA." monster you control to the hand, except "UA. Mighty Slugger". You can only Special Summon "UA. Mighty Slugger" once per turn this way. If this card attacks, your opponent cannot activate cards or effects until the end of the Damage Step.

The first of the more offensive line and this is my go to for easy damage or to pair with the equip spell due to how safe he is!

The effect is brilliant and is great when you suspect a nasty trap your enemy has laid or a hand trap you are worried they might have as it allows you to attack with complete confidence.

I've also found its great against say an annoying monster effect thats perhaps making your other offensive attacks near impossible.

overall great card and always a staple!

UA Perfect Ace 5* 1500 / 2500:

You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by returning 1 "UA." monster you control to the hand, except "UA. Perfect Ace". You can only Special Summon "UA. Perfect Ace" once per turn this way. Once per turn, during your opponent's turn, when a card or effect is activated: You can discard 1 card; negate that activation, and if you do, destroy it (this is a Quick Effect).

The first of your defensive line and an amazing combo breaker and negation tool against your opponent.

its a shame its a once per turn but even so this has saved my skin or even caused my opponent to scoop with its effect.

Still a must have in the deck and offers great counterplay options!

UA Rival Rebounder 6* 2200 / 2300:

You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by returning 1 "UA." monster you control to the hand, except "UA. Rival Rebounder". You can only Special Summon "UA. Rival Rebounder" once per turn this way. If this card is Special Summoned during your opponent's turn, or Normal Summoned: You can Special Summon 1 "UA." monster from your hand or Graveyard, except "UA. Rival Rebounder". You can only use this effect of "UA. Rival Rebounder" once per turn.

An interesting card.. used to be a little more situational to get out but with Libero i find it certainly a mainstay in the deck!

You will typically want to get this card out during your opponent turn as its the only UA card that can get things back from the GY or alternatively a great way to play a counter monster to your opponent from your hand.

he helps get more onto your board and for that i always run him!

He also is a great pairing for "UA Turnover tactics" as you can also do that on your opponents turn.

UA Goalkeeper 6* 1000 / 2800:

You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by returning 1 "UA." monster you control to the hand, except "UA. Goalkeeper". You can only Special Summon "UA. Goalkeeper" once per turn this way. Once per turn, during your opponent's turn: You can target 1 "UA." monster you control; once during this turn, it cannot be destroyed by battle or card effects (this is a Quick Effect).

Doesn't see too much play but i am a great believer in thsi card and it has saved me many a time!

Even if its just to take one more hit on your monsters to limit your opponent this can put a halt to a OTK and gives you one more turn to pull off a retaliation that can win you the duel!

Note he can use his effect on himself and with a great 2800 defence he can sometimes be tricky to take out!

UA Dreadnought Dunker 7* 2500 / 1800:

You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by returning 1 "UA." monster you control to the hand, except "UA. Dreadnought Dunker". You can only Special Summon "UA. Dreadnought Dunker" once per turn this way. If this card attacks a Defense Position monster, inflict piercing battle damage to your opponent. When this card inflicts battle damage to your opponent: You can target 1 card on the field; destroy it.

He's your big boi to help clear boards and open up opponents the target 1 card is great for dealing with pesky backrows or a boss monster you cant quite get past.

The piercing damage is great when you can force an opponent to play defensivly, this happens more often than not as with UA you can easily top over 3000 attack meaning unless your opponent knows your deck they will typically start playing defence until this bad boi comes out!

A Great card although can cause bad plays due to how exposed he can be when attacking or when using the target effect.

UA BlockBacker 7* 1600 / 2700:

You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by returning 1 "UA." monster you control to the hand, except "UA. Blockbacker". You can only Special Summon "UA. Blockbacker" once per turn this way. Once per turn, when your opponent Special Summons a monster(s): You can change their battle positions, and if you do, negate their effects.

An interesting card but due to its lack of quick effect can sometimes not pull off his effect as it can be chained.

I will typically use him when i play "turnover tactics" as he is brilliant at stopping whatever the opponent brings out

good defence although would of been nice to have his effect a quick effect.

UA Playmaker 8* 2600 / 2000:

You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by returning 1 "UA." monster you control to the hand, except "UA. Playmaker". You can only Special Summon "UA. Playmaker" once per turn this way. When another "UA." monster you control declares an attack: You can have this card lose exactly 800 ATK, and if you do, your attacking monster gains 800 ATK.

Your OTK boi, helps buff your guys for that killing blow or get you just over an opponents beatstick.

I find he works best with Slugger as the extra protection slugger gets means he wont potentialy waste this attack.

Remember you can attack with playmaker first at max attack THEN use his effect to buff someone else meaning a free 800 attack during that damage.

His effect can go on every turn as well menaing your stronger monsters can get to silly attack easily.

A good card but situational.

UA Player Manager 8* 2000 / 2600:

If you Normal or Special Summon a "UA." monster(s) (except during the Damage Step): You can Special Summon this card from your hand. If this card is Special Summoned: You can activate 1 of these effects.

● Target 1 card on the field; destroy it.

● Negate the effects of all face-up monsters on the field until the end of this turn, except "UA." monsters.

You can only use each effect of "UA. Player Manager" once per turn.

The last of the new support monsters and my god what a great addition!

you have a very easy free destruction or a negate all monster effects meaning he is a great anti board blocker and allows your unprotected UA monsters to confidently attack!

He is very easy to get out and works wonders with Rival rebounder or turnover tactics.

I love this card and is a great addition to the lineup!

Now moving on to the spells this is where most your synergy and tactics come into play and UA have some amazing spells which opponents often wont realise are so strong until its too late!

UA Stadium (Field Spell):

If a "UA." monster is Normal Summoned to your side of the field: You can add 1 "UA." monster from your Deck to your hand. Once per turn, if a "UA." monster(s) is Special Summoned to your side of the field: All monsters you currently control gain 500 ATK (even if this card leaves the field).

Wow! What a great field spell! its a free search that helps builds up your play strategy AND a permanant 500 attack boost for your special summons!

This is a card that can quickly help your UA spiral into absolute damaging gods and with the free search it can really help build your combos.

A must have for your opening hand if possible!

UA Hyper stadium (Field spell):

(This card is always treated as a "FA." card.) When this card is activated: You can add 1 "UA." or "FA." monster from your Deck to your hand, OR add 1 "UA. Stadium" from your GY to your hand. You can reveal 1 Field Spell in your hand and pay 1000 LP; you can Normal Summon 1 "UA." or "FA." monster during your Main Phase this turn, in addition to your Normal Summon/Set. (You can only gain this effect once per turn.) You can only activate 1 "UA. Hyper Stadium" per turn.

One of the new support spells and its a nice one!

This helps you with a free UA search the moment its activated so helps the deck brick less as you can still pull a 4* if you are lacking.

The add 1 UA stadium is also very useful but the additional normal summon i havent found too much use for. The only times i found it helped is when my opponent negated my normal summon and i have another level 4 and another field spell in my hand but this didnt happen too often.

UA Powered Jersey (equip spell):

Equip only to a "UA." monster. It gains 1000 ATK and DEF, also if it battles an opponent's monster, any battle damage it inflicts to your opponent is doubled. If the equipped monster destroys a monster by its attack: It can make a second attack during this Battle Phase. During your Standby Phase: Banish the equipped monster. If this card is sent to the Graveyard because the equipped monster returned to the hand: You can return this card to the hand.

This... This is disgustingly good! it's your ultimate finisher and OTK potential machine and my god does your opponent not see it coming!

the 1000 attack and defence is great but the magic lies in the almost secret double damage! For some reason most opponents skim over this but my god is it deadly!

The extra attack can really help clear boards and the best part is... once youve done what you needed to and the enemy is left hanging on by a thread you can swap out your offensive card for your defensive line and get powered jearsy back for FREE! ready to finish them off next turn.

Although very powerful you dont want too many in your deck as it can cause bricks.

Great fun to use but very much an overkill card.

UA Signing Deal (normal spell):

Special Summon 1 "UA." monster from your Deck, but its effects are negated, also it cannot be used as Synchro or Xyz Material for a Summon. Then you lose LP equal to that monster's Level x 300. You can only activate 1 "UA. Signing Deal" per turn.

This is a great emergency use card and the best thing is you can ignore the negated effects part because thanks to UA you can just switch them out!

This is your "a hero lives" card and is a nice suppliment to help you get back into the fight or if you have a bad start.

UA Turnover Tactics (quickplay):

If you control 2 or more "UA." monsters with different names: Shuffle as many monsters on the field as possible into the Deck, then Special Summon "UA." monsters from your Deck that have different names from each other, up to the number of cards shuffled into your Main Deck, but those monsters cannot attack this turn. Then your opponent can Special Summon monsters from their Deck, up to the number of cards shuffled into their Main Deck. You can only activate 1 "UA. Turnover Tactics" per turn.

Oooooo is this a fun one! this card has single handedly saved me games, completley ruined opponents plays and caused many an opponents scoop!

The card helps you get out of a bad situation or combos well with your rival rebounder on your opponents turn or backblocker to really annoy them.

This cards secret though? use it when your opponent plays a heavy extra deck and watch them cry!

lets say they have a Utopia deck and they have 3 or 4 of the big Utopia boys out and are giving you an awful time.

play this and swap your poor UA out for some more... but wait... the opponent has to also shuffle their cards back in and special summon the same amount out with different names... i could be left with even stronger monsters to deal with!

Ahhhh well thats where the "Then your opponent can Special Summon monsters from their Deck, up to the number of cards shuffled into their Main Deck*."* Comes in handy!

remember it says Main deck so if they are playing heavy extra deck it means they can't replace any of their big bois as they go back to the EXTRA deck leaving them wide open for you to finish the game.

This card has won and saved me too many times to count!

UA Locker room (quick play):

(This card is always treated as a "FA." card.) Target 1 "UA." or "FA." monster you control or in your GY; add it to the hand, and if you do, you gain 500 LP, then you can apply this effect. ● Reveal any number of "UA." and/or "FA." monsters in your hand, shuffle them into the Deck, then draw cards equal to the number of shuffled cards. You can only activate 1 "UA. Locker Room" per turn.

An interesting one... i haven't played this one much i must say but it is a useful card!

the gain 500LP is trivial but its again another way to now get your dead UA monsters back.

the shuffle and draw again is helpful against a brick but this can sometimes be a dead draw card

MOVING ON! We lastly have our traps!

UA Penalty Box (Continuous):

At the start of the Damage Step, if your "UA." monster battles an opponent's monster: You can banish that opponent's monster until your opponent's 2nd End Phase. You can only use this effect of "UA. Penalty Box" once per turn. You can banish this card from your Graveyard; add 1 "UA." Spell Card from your Deck to your hand.

A Lovely Utility with the free spell search! but also it is the true definition of a trap!

Your opponent can have a big boi literally vanish (Albiet for 2 turns) leaving them open or disrupting their combos!

Remember you can also use this on your turn to charge head on to a monster and instantly say BYE leaving them exposed and open.

Great trap and wholeheart reccomend!

UA Man of the Match (Trap):

(This card is always treated as a "FA." card.) After damage calculation, if your "UA." or "FA." monster destroyed an opponent's monster by battle, OR when your "UA." or "FA." monster inflicts battle damage to your opponent: Special Summon any number of "UA." and/or "FA." monsters with different names from your hand and/or GY in Defense Position. You can only activate 1 "UA. Man of the Match" per turn.

Sounds good on paper for swarming but i dont run it becuase i prefer the other options.

To deal damage to your opponent, you have to special summon monsters from your Extra Deck or Graveyard such as Black Rose Dragon to activate it's effects, which allows the user to target one of the opponent's monster and to change it's atk to 0 ... basicially a mix between destruction and damage dealing. In this case, the player has to summon Synchro Monsters (either from the Graveyard {by the effects of Blue Rose Dragon or Basal Rose Shoot/Black Garden} or from the Extra Deck {via. synchro summon or the effects of monsters such as Ruddyrose Dragon/Crossrose Dragon}). It does not sound easy, right? Well the thing is, that this deck is kinda outdated, especially with only one way of negating effects (Ruddy Rose Dragon). So instead of showing you a way to play a meta deck, I will show you the probably fastest and easiest way of summoning destructive and fearless Monsters Monster Cards: In this deck we use a mix of main deck monsters and extra deck monsters (especially main deck monsters as tuning materials)
  • Rose Dragons: mainly used as fast synchro materials and to search out supportive spells and traps (feat. the "Rose" archetype)
  • Plant Monsters: used as synchro or link materials, also used as cards to either search out other plant monsters or to special summon plant tokens on the field
Spell Cards:
  • Quick-Play Spell Cards: mainly used to special summon several Rose Dragons (either from the hand or graveyard) or to search out possible extra deck materials
  • Field Spell Cards: mainly used to either boost up your Rose Synchro Dragon or to special summon it by tributing plant monsters on the field (they are in generell plant tokens)

If you suggest some other cards to put in this deck, or if you think that some of those cards are useless, please write your opinion in the comments, so that we could bring gimmick puppets in the meta togheter. deck_excerpt: A fine, budget Eldlich deck to farm the ladder, if you can handle a miserable grind game for a while before building a deck that you actually wanna pl
deck_description: Hi, it's me again, Grayewick the Fusion strategy enjoyer, back with a budget list of one of the most common decks right now in the Master Duel ladder, Eldlich. I normally wouldn't suggest this deck to anyone at all, including Sky Strikers not because they're bad, but for various reasons I do not wish to state, especially if you already have a deck in mind in which you are confident enough that you can actually pilot competently enough, but the only reason as to why I do is simply because of how easy it is to obtain and pilot, and how it interacts with the low rarity staples in the game. Also, Eldlich is technically a Fusion strategy, except we don't really have the Seven Cities of the Golden Land to fuse yet (correction, we do already have it, it's just that Eldlich, the Mad Golden Lord is another UR that you'd have to pull/craft, so unless you're dedicated to Eldlich, I don't recommend building using it), but anyway. I made this list as free to play as possible, and with the assumption that you've already done the basic free to play routine at this point in the game. Addressing the deck list: • x3 Forbidden Chalice into x3 Forbidden Droplet = Forbidden Droplet, alongside Solemn Judgment, are probably two of the most easily obtainable and most powerful staples in the game, hands down. You can easily unlock it buy either crafting a random UR/SR "Forbidden" or "Darklord" card to unlock the "Deceitful Wings of Darkness" Secret Pack, where you can farm it there by unlocking packs and get crafting materials. What this also allows you to do is to pivot into the Darklord strategy, if that interests you in any way, shape, or form, or just as an investment for future support/archetype releases that might have synergy with it, such as Despia. • x3 Horn of Heaven and x1 Solemn Judgment into x3 Solemn Judgment and x1 Imperial Order = Pretty self-explanatory. You can easily unlock Solemn Judgment by either crafting a random UR/SR "Parshath" or "Agent" card to unlock the "Guardians of the Sacred Sky" Secret Pack, where you can farm it there by unlocking packs and get crafting materials. What this also allows you to do is to pivot into the Counter Fairies strategy, a classic control deck that focuses mainly on the small Fairy-type monsters that gain effects upon activating a Counter Trap, which also has great synergy with Eldlich. I have also made a list for that if it interests you in this link: https://ygoprodeck.com/counter-fairy-eldlich-master-duel/ • x3 Bottomless Trap Hole and x3 Ice Dragon's Prison = These two, you can actually decide to play together if you want, in any ratio you see fit. • x3 Lost Wind into x3 Infinite Impermanence = I'm actually on the fence between these two, because they both have their own strengths and weaknesses. The former being not minding getting discarded for Eldlich or Forbidden Droplet, and the latter essentially being used to either lock down a column from Spells or as a defensive tool going second. I'll leave this one up to your personal preference. • x1 Number 61: Volcasaurus into x1 Constellar Pleiades = Good enough boss monster with a non-destruction quick play interruption, while the former is a monster spot removal but worse. More budget options: • Heavy Storm Duster (SR) - This is considered a budget option due to a play set of this being guaranteed to be available in the "Magician of Pendulum" Structure Deck. Buy with caution. • Fiendish Chain/Phantom Knights' Fog Blade (R) - Both monster interruptions that stay on the field. • Dark Core (R) - Outs monsters that cannot be destroyed by card effects but can still be targeted. Also a discard enabler. • Floodgate Trap Hole (R) - Great against swarm and Pendulum decks, or just non-Link boss monsters that are pretty difficult to out. • Dust Tornado (R) - Back row removal and potential set up. • Raigeki Break (R) - Generic spot removal and discard enabler. • Ballista Squad (R) - Generic spot removal and enables Lightning Storm if you decide to play it. • Magic Jammer/Magic Drain/Divine Wrath (R) - Generic Counter Traps that are also discard enablers. • Light-Imprisoning Mirror/Shadow-Imprisoning Mirror (R) - Attribute related floodgates. • Trap Jammer (N) - Also a generic Counter Trap, could be nice on mirror matches. The extra deck is pretty self-explanatory being filled with either Dogmatika Punishment targets or Pot of Prosperity fodders. Make use of Psy-Framelord Omega, Elder Entity N'tss, and Wind Pegasus @Ignister as soon as you get hold of them. Super Polymerization can also be a cute tech, in case you run into Eldlich mirror matches. That's pretty much everything there is to it.

deck_excerpt: A combo-heavier version of tri-brigade that fully utilizes the Crystal Beast engine. Plays well through interruptions and has an excellent grind game.
deck_description: Crystal Beasts, Tri-Brigades, and Albaz have a myriad of synergies with each other that this deck aims to exploit.  The Crystal Beast engine adds level 4 Beasts to the field and beasts/dragons to the hand, generating a ton of card advantage but lacking a clear way to exploit that advantage.  Tri-Brigades use those beasts on field to advance their plays and use the extra cards added to hand from Crystal Beast Rainbow Dragon to pay costs of cards like Tri-Brigade Bearbrumm, Tri-Brigade Ferrijit, and Tri-Brigade Kerass. These are the monsters that create the big plays and provide much of the grind game.  Tri-Brigade Mercourier, when banished, can add one of several cards from your deck to hand. Most often, you will often grab Albion the Shrouded, whose effect sends Branded Blade from Deck to grave in order to draw and add Mercourier back to hand. When in hand, it functions as a monster negate when you have an Albaz on the field  Branded in High Spirit converts a beast/dragon in hand into any of your albaz-related monsters - most often you'll grab Springans Kitt which can then special summon itself and grab Branded in Red or Branded Condemnation. It will send either Brigand or Albion the Branded Dragon from extra deck to grave, which will supply you an additional interruption or follow-up.  Allure of Darkness either converts the Rainbow Dark Dragon into tangible advantage or triggers Tri-Brigade Mercourier (providing a +2 when used to add Albion the Shrouded)  Your typical going first play is to land on Verte + Bearbrumm on field with mercourier in hand, then use Verte to send Branded Fusion to grave, fusing Albaz from deck with the Bearbrumm on field into Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon.  Then Bearbrumm will add Revolt to your hand. If you opened branded in high spirits, this can be further backed up with Branded in Red (for Guardian Chimera) and/or Branded Condemnation, leaving you with a board of 5-6 interruptions all coming from different places and a ton of cards added to your hand on the opponent's turn for turn 3 to guarantee you win the duel.

deck_description: Your main strategy is to start with Foxy (for +1), Link summon Balelynx (Link 1) and grab Sanctuary (for +1 and protection),  and/or use special summon bodies like Jack Jaguar and Spinny to advance to Sunlight Wolf (Link 2) and special summon another body to his link (for +1), then advance into Heatleo (Link 3) for non-destruction Spell/Trap removal or Pyro Phoenix (Link 4) and activate Sanctuary to summon him on top of itself to full wipe your opponent's board.  After you finish your Link plays you should end up with at least 1 Balelynx and a few Salamangreats in your GY. After this point you can set your counters (Roar, Solemn Judgment and Infinite Impermanence) and prepare yourself for the coming turn. Roar is basically a budget Solemn Judgment that has no cost and only requires you to have 1 Salamangreat Link monster (which you can always have, even Balelynx works) and you can recover it afterwards when you Link summon on top of the same monster with Sanctuary's effect. Make sure you start your plays with Foxy to benefit from pure +1 and use your Circle to pick whatever Salamangreat you are currently missing in your hand. More names = more summons, because each Salamangreat effect monster has a hard once per turn tied to its special summon.  Salamangreats are very versatile and offer easy recovery from GY. Only problem they have is non-target removal and that's why it is a budget deck. Decode Talker, Transcode Talker, Rasterliger and Flame Administrator are simply to offer ATK boost incase you run into a destruction immune boss monster. Firewall Dragon is cumbersome to summon but if you have Will Of The Salamangreat and Sanctuary on the field, you can summon Sunlight Wolf on top of itself to revive the second copy from GY and go into Firewall Dragon easily. It offers non-destruction removal in case you need it.

It's absolutely cheap, you only really need two in-archetype UR cards and 3 in-archetype SR cards, and the entire Tenyi core in the main deck is literally made up of Rares and Commons. This deck has only one goal in mind, and that is to set up Avramax as soon as you can and summon either Vanity's Fiend going 1st or Archnemeses Protos as soon as you can. A few questions you might have: • "Why Vanity's Fiend instead of Vanity's Ruler?" - Because the former only requires you to tribute one monster for its Tribute Summon, and that actually matters because it allows you to have enough monsters for a Synchro Summon of a defensive monster like Adamancipator Risen - Dragite alongside your Avramax, which is actually a better option than Borreload Savage Dragon since Shaman of the Tenyi prevents you from activating the effects of non-"Tenyi" monsters that are Special Summoned from the Extra Deck upon using its effect to Special Summon a Wyrm monster from the GY (most likely a Mare Mare). • "Evenly Matched and Ice Dragon's Prison on the main?" - Yes, there are no side decks (as of now) in Master Duel. These slots could be for any high impact/consistency staples, really, and that includes your hand traps if you're the type of guy who prefers Maxx "C" over anything. If you don't have any defensive hand traps yet, you can add more Mare Mare, Shthana, and Mapura in a ratio of your liking. I wanna keep it short and sweet since it's a pretty straightforward deck to play, and there's really nothing much else to say about it. Have fun.

deck_excerpt: Almost pure @Ignister deck whose goal is to bring out Arrival with at least 5000 ATK
deck_description: The goal is to bring out Arrival with ideally at least 5000 ATK; it is unaffected by other cards' effects, which would most probably win you the game unless they have cards like Kaiju that could take it off the field through atypical means. There are many routes to the boss monster; however, the most practical sequence is Dark Infant (search out Ignister AILand) >> Cyberse Wicckid (search out Bururu) >> Splash Mage (don't use effect for the meantime) >> Transcode Talker (summon Splash Mage then use its effect) >> Dark Templar (optional, depending on availability of elements required) >> Arrival (with ideally at least 5000 ATK). Of course, other cards (@Ignister effect monsters, resurrection spells, searching spells) are omitted in the sequence due to the indeterminate game state. The logic behind the sequence is that the field spell Ignister AILand only allows you to special summon when there are no monsters on your Main Monster zone. These link monsters serve as buffers, which allow you to special summon @Ignister effect monsters from your hand or through spells (FAIghting Spirit, AIdle Reborn). You have to keep track which @Ignister monsters have activated their effects due to the once per turn restriction. Also, you must keep track of the elements of your summoned monsters in order to fulfill the requirements for Arrival. If you have Transcode Talker (Earth), Splash Mage (Water), and another monster summoned by Splash Mage's effect while you have Doshin (Earth) and/or Hiyari (Water) on your hand, you can go for Dark Templar (Dark) and use its effect along with resurrection spells (FAIghting Spirit, AIdle Reborn) or a search spell (AI Meet You) in order to bring out 5 different elements from the GY or hand. For emergencies, use Link Disciple (Light) to replace a redundant element. When Link summoning, don't forget to start from the effect monsters all the way to the Link monsters in ascending Link rating; starting from the Link-3 Transcode Talker or Dark Templar will only allow you to select at most three other materials since Arrival is a Link-6 (This is for Dueling Nexus mechanics). If you feel like you can't bring out 5000 ATK Arrival due to the lack of resources, you can choose to go for other @Ignister monsters (Fire Phoenix, Light Dragon, etc.) or Accesscode Talker for board cleaning. If there are other useful cards that were not included here, please leave a comment so that I can broaden my horizons through the spirit of learning, and perhaps grief my opponents with a stronger deck. Thank you for viewing.
